creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: Inside two wooden boxes; not wrapped in tissue; fabric is tan and green foliage pattern; image of the moon behind a pine tree branch; three lines of script LL corner
inscription: 松子南望照飲泉　山中高臥豈將仙　此來當笑皆依舊　何獨文章不流連 (Gazing south through pine cones, there shines my drinking brook: / Here in the mountains, calmly reclining, could I almost be an immortal? / Coming here again, I must laugh—everything just the same, / So why is my writing—that alone!—not flowing effortlessly?) [Jonathan Chaves]
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #2]; LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #1], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #1]
signed: 古道人詩畫 {Kodōjin shiga} (poem and painting by Kodōjin)
title: Moon and Pine Tree
